intro: Stigmaphyllon eggersii, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features a short, thick stem with spiny areoles, typical of many cacti. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for collectors and gardeners in suitable climates.
